required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Potential Role Of MicroRNA-155 And Telomerase Reverse Transcriptase In Diagnosis Of Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer And Their Pathological Correlation
clinical_study.official_title: The Potential Role Of MicroRNA-155 And Telomerase Reverse Transcriptase In Diagnosis Of Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer And Their Pathological Correlation

brief_summary.textblock: We try to assess the potential role of telomerase reverse transcriptase and MicroRNA (miR-155) in diagnosis of non-muscle-invasive bladder cancer and their correlation with stage and grade of the tumor.

primary_outcome.measure: sensitivity, specificity and positive and negative predictive values of combined MicroRNA-155 And Telomerase Reverse Transcriptase In diagnosis Of Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer
primary_outcome.description: compared by standard final pathological specimen

secondary_outcome.measure: correlation between serum Vit D and Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer
secondary_outcome.description: measured serum Vit D in ng/mL.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Hematuria due to suspicious superficial bladder tumor
arm_group.description: MicroRNAs-155 (miRNAs-155) and Human telomerase reverse transcriptase (hTERT)

intervention.description: Quantitative analysis of cell-free miR-155 using RT-qPCR.
intervention.arm_group_label: Hematuria due to suspicious superficial bladder tumor

intervention.description: Analysis TERT by TERT messenger RNA (mRNA)expression by reverse transcription-quantitative polymerase chain reaction.
intervention.arm_group_label: Hematuria due to suspicious superficial bladder tumor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women 18 years or older.
- Patient with hematuria suspected to be of bladder origin clinically.
- Willing to be participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient having another malignancy.
- Hematuria of other causes as trauma and stones
